00016 CPatcher::CPatcher(CExeFile &ExeFile) {
00017  m_episode = ExeFile.getEpisode();
00018  m_version = ExeFile.getEXEVersion();
00019  m_data = ExeFile.getRawData();
00020  m_datadirectory = ExeFile.getDataDirectory();
00021  m_datasize = ExeFile.getExeDataSize();
00022 }
00023 
00024 void CPatcher::patchMemory()
00025 {
00026  if(!loadPatchfile()) return;
00027 
00028  // If the file was found and read into the m_TextList,
00029  // then read out of the list the patch commands and apply them to the
00030  // Exe-file data m_data
00031  
00032  g_pLogFile->textOut("Trying to load and apply the patch it found...<br>");
00033  
00034  filterPatches();
00035 
00036  patch_item PatchItem;
00037 
00038  std::string dumpfilename = "";
00039 
00040  // TODO: Extend this part further with more commands
00041  while(readNextPatchItem(PatchItem) == true)
00042  {
00043   // Now we really start to process the commands
00044   if(PatchItem.keyword == "ext")
00045   {
00046    // Check's if patch matches with the episode
00047    std::string extText = readPatchItemsNextValue(PatchItem.value);
00048 
00049    if(strCaseStartsWith(extText,"ck"))
00050    {
00051     if(atoi(extText.substr(2)) != m_episode)
00052     {
00053      g_pLogFile->textOut("Error! The patch-file does not match the opened episode!!!<br>");
00054      return;
00055     }
00056    }
00057   }
00058   else if(PatchItem.keyword == "patchfile")
00059   {
00060    std::string newbuf = PatchItem.value.front();
00061 
00062    // Seperate the offset and the filename
00063    long offset;
00064    size_t p = newbuf.find(' ');
00065    sscanf(newbuf.substr(0,p).c_str(), "%lx", &offset);
00066    std::string patch_file_name = newbuf.substr(p);
00067    TrimSpaces(patch_file_name);
00068 
00069    patchMemfromFile(m_datadirectory + "/" + patch_file_name,offset);
00070   }
00071   else if(PatchItem.keyword == "patch" )
00072   {
00073    // first we need to get the offset
00074    long offset = 0;
00075    std::string textline = readPatchItemsNextValue(PatchItem.value);
00076    if(readIntValue(textline, offset))
00077    {
00078     while(!PatchItem.value.empty())
00079     {
00080      // after we have it, distinguish between text case and number case
00081      long number = 0;
00082      std::string patchtext = "";
00083      textline = readPatchItemsNextValue(PatchItem.value);
00084 
00085      if(readIntValue(textline, number))
00086      {
00087       // In this case we have a number
00088       m_data[offset] = number;
00089       offset++;
00090      }
00091      else if(readPatchString(textline, patchtext))
00092      {
00093       size_t textsize = patchtext.size();
00094       memcpy( m_data+offset, patchtext.c_str(), textsize);
00095       offset += textsize;
00096      }
00097     }
00098    }
00099    else
00100     g_pLogFile->textOut("Something is wrong with the \%patch command. A number was expected<br>");
00101   }
00102   else if(PatchItem.keyword == "level.hint" )
00103   {
00104    // Patch the level hints
00105    std::string textline = readPatchItemsNextValue(PatchItem.value);
00106    long number = 0;
00107 
00108    if(readIntValue(textline, number))
00109    {
00110     // You have a level hint. Very good, lets read it and patch!
00111     PatchLevelhint(number,PatchItem.value);
00112    }
00113   }
00114   else if(PatchItem.keyword == "dump" )
00115   {
00116    std::string textline = readPatchItemsNextValue(PatchItem.value);
00117    if(readPatchString(textline, dumpfilename))
00118     g_pLogFile->textOut("CG will dump out the exe-content to \""+ dumpfilename +"\"<br>" );
00119   }
00120   else if(PatchItem.keyword == "end" )
00121   {
00122    g_pLogFile->textOut("End of Patchfile!<br>");
00123    break;
00124   }
00125   else
00126    g_pLogFile->textOut("The Keyword " + PatchItem.keyword + " is not supported by CG yet!<br>" );
00127 
00128   if(dumpfilename!="")
00129   {
00130    std::ofstream DumpFile;
00131    if(OpenGameFileW(DumpFile,dumpfilename,std::ios::binary))
00132    {
00133     DumpFile.write(reinterpret_cast<const char*>(m_data),m_datasize);
00134     DumpFile.close();
00135    }
00136   }
00137 
00138   PatchItem.keyword.clear();
00139   PatchItem.value.clear();
00140  }
00141  // If we want a dump, make it happen!!
00142 }
00143 
00144 struct PatchListFiller {
00145  std::set<std::string> list;
00146  
00147  bool operator() (const std::string& filename) {
00148   std::string ext = GetFileExtension(filename);
00149   if (stringcaseequal(ext, "pat"))
00150    list.insert(filename);
00151   
00152   return true;
00153  }
00154 };
00155 
00156 /**
00157  * \brief this reads the patch into the m_TextList
00158  * \return true if something could be read. Otherwise false
00159  */
00160 bool CPatcher::loadPatchfile()
00161 {
00162  std::string path = m_datadirectory;
00163  
00164  //Get the list of ".pat" files
00165  PatchListFiller patchlist;
00166  FindFiles(patchlist, path, false, FM_REG);
00167  
00168  // Nothing to patch, just quit
00169  if (!patchlist.list.size())
00170   return false;
00171  
00172  if (patchlist.list.size() > 1)
00173   g_pLogFile->textOut(PURPLE,"Multiple Patches are not yet supported! Please remove a file. Taking one File.<br>");
00174  
00175  while(!patchlist.list.empty())
00176  {
00177   std::string buf = *patchlist.list.begin();
00178   std::ifstream Patchfile; OpenGameFileR(Patchfile, buf);
00179   
00180   while(!Patchfile.eof())
00181   {
00182    char buf[256];
00183    Patchfile.getline(buf, sizeof(buf));
00184    fix_markend(buf);
00185    m_TextList.push_back(buf);
00186   }
00187   Patchfile.close();
00188   patchlist.list.clear();
00189  }
00190  
00191  return true;
00192 }
00193 
00194 void CPatcher::patchMemfromFile(const std::string& patch_file_name, long offset)
00195 {
00196  unsigned char *buf_to_patch;
00197  unsigned char byte;
00198  
00199  std::ifstream Patchfile; OpenGameFileR(Patchfile, patch_file_name, std::ios::binary);
00200  
00201  if(!Patchfile) return;
00202  
00203  if(!m_data)
00204  {
00205   g_pLogFile->textOut(PURPLE,"Warning: The patchfile was wrongly read!<br>");
00206   return;
00207  }
00208  
00209  buf_to_patch = m_data + offset;
00210  
00211  long counter = 0;
00212  while(!Patchfile.eof())
00213  {
00214   byte = (unsigned char) Patchfile.get();
00215   memcpy(buf_to_patch+counter,&byte,1); // one byte every time ;-)
00216   counter++;
00217  }
00218  
00219  Patchfile.close();
00220 }
00221 
00222 void CPatcher::PatchLevelhint(const int level, std::list<std::string> &input)
00223 {
00224  unsigned char *p_patch;
00225  unsigned long offset=0;
00226  unsigned long end=0;
00227 
00228  // Check for which level is it for.
00229  if(m_episode == 1)
00230  {
00231   switch(level)
00232   {
00233   case 2:  offset = 0x15080; end = 0x15113; break;
00234   case 6:  offset = 0x1511A; end = 0x151B3; break;
00235   case 9:  offset = 0x151B4, end = 0x1524D; break;
00236   case 10: offset = 0x1524E; end = 0x152E7; break;
00237   case 11: offset = 0x152E8; end = 0x1533F; break;
00238   case 12: offset = 0x15340; end = 0x153DA; break;
00239   case 15: offset = 0x153DB; end = 0x1545E; break;
00240   }
00241  }
00242  else if(m_episode == 2)
00243  {
00244   switch(level)
00245   {
00246   case 8:  offset = 0x19FCC; end = 0x1A08B; break;
00247   case 12:  offset = 0x1A08B; end = 0x1A1A0; break;
00248   }
00249  }
00250 
00251  p_patch = m_data + offset;
00252 
00253  // Fill everything with zeros, so the old text won't be shown
00254  if(end > offset)
00255   memset( p_patch, 0, end-offset);
00256 
00257  std::string buf;
00258  do
00259  {
00260   buf = input.front();
00261   memcpy(p_patch, buf.c_str(), buf.size());
00262   input.pop_front();
00263   p_patch += buf.size()-1;
00264   if(*p_patch != '\r')
00265    p_patch++;
00266   p_patch[0] = 0x0A;
00267   p_patch[1] = 0x00;
00268   p_patch += 2;
00269   if( p_patch == m_data+end ) break;
00270  } while( !input.empty() );
00271 }
